byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar and Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from St. Petersburg, Russia.

abstract: Negotiations over Greek bailout have become increasingly messy and public, with both sides in negotiations predicting doom and disaster should negotiations fail; analysts suggest that publicly expressed bitterness over negotiations may be tactic to avoid being blamed for failure to come to agreement, despite fact that every important deadline has been extended.
lead_paragraph: Like prizefighters, the two sides of the negotiations over the Greek bailout have been circling each other, throwing punch after punch.

headline.main: Greece and Its Creditors Pummel Each Other, but Fight Is Not Over Yet
headline.print_headline: Greece and Its Creditors Pummel Each Other, but Fight Is Not Over Yet

snippet: Like prizefighters, the two sides of the negotiations over the Greek bailout have been circling each other, throwing punch after punch.
